content.description:
TWO SCENES FROM SOWING AND REAPING, A YUAN-DYNASTY (CIRCA 1350) COPY OF A SONG-DYNASTY (CIRCA 1150) ILLUSTRATED SCROLL ABOUT THE PRACTICE OF RICE CULTIVATION IN CHINA.

Image 1:

Purchase, W. M. Keck Foundation Gift and other gifts, in memory of Douglas Dillon, 2005

Workers irrigating a rice field by powering a mechanical water wheel with their feet

Image 2:

Purchase, W. M. Keck Foundation Gift and other gifts, in memory of Douglas Dillon, 2005

Men, women, and children harvesting rice
content.question: The activity depicted in Image 2 best illustrates which of the following characteristics of China’s economy before 1450 ?

choices.label: The influence of Confucian labor policies
The impact of innovations borrowed from surrounding states
The reliance on systems of peasant labor
The dependence on trade along the Silk Roads

content.answer: The reliance on systems of peasant labor

topic.text: 1.1: Developments in East Asia from c. 1200 to c. 1450
